alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Bedford; Botetourt; City of Roanoke; City of Salem; Craig; Floyd; Franklin; Henry; Montgomery; Patrick; Roanoke (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 5:05AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Virginia, southwest Virginia and west central Virginia, including the following counties and independent cities, in south central Virginia, Bedford and Henry. In southwest Virginia, Craig, Floyd, Montgomery and Patrick. In west central Virginia, Alleghany VA, Botetourt, City of Roanoke, City of Salem, Franklin and Roanoke. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 505 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Allen Creek, Back Creek and Barbours Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roanoke... Salem... Christiansburg... Vinton... Rocky Mount... Buchanan... Troutville... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
